parameters.description: Ion temperature images calculated from ENA fluxes in each GSM spatial bin

parameters.name: temparraysM
parameters.description: --> Movie of Ion temperature images calculated from ENA fluxes in each GSM spatial bin

parameters.name: tot_time2
parameters.description: Time interval used for Ti calculation

parameters.name: errorarrays
parameters.description: [NO PLOT] Error in each energy-space bin based on the error given by the algorithm that calculates the flux from the raw TWINS data.

parameters.name: counterrors
parameters.description: [NO PLOT] Another error value determined as 1/sqrt(countarrays).

parameters.name: delta_deg
parameters.description: Uncertainty in the angle that gives the direction in which the TWINS instrument is pointing.

parameters.name: Ion_Temperature_flipped
parameters.description: Inner Magnetospheric Ion Temperature images

parameters.name: Ion_Temperature_movie
parameters.description: ---> Movie display

parameters.name: Satellite
parameters.description: TWINS Satellite 1 or 2 Used to calculate Ion Temperature

parameters.name: X_GSM
parameters.description: TWINS Spacecraft Location X GSM [RE]

parameters.name: Y_GSM
parameters.description: TWINS Spacecraft Location Y GSM [RE]

parameters.name: Z_GSM
parameters.description: TWINS Spacecraft Location Z GSM [RE]

parameters.name: Active_Region_flipped
parameters.description: Active Region Z Score

parameters.name: Active_Region_flipped_mv
parameters.description: --> Movie display of above

parameters.name: Coverage_flag
parameters.description: The 5-level quality flag for data coverage. 5-level quality flag for data coverage. 5 > 95%, 4 > 90%, 3 > 75%, 2 > 50%, 1 > 25%

parameters.name: ErrorFlag
parameters.description: Overlap of TWINS error array and the overlapped identified active regions. Error_array comes from the estimation of the error in the flux values from the statistical smoothing algorithm. 0 = good quality, 1 = bad

parameters.name: Count_Error
parameters.description: The Count_Error spatial map. The Count_Error is the energy averaged from raw counts per instrument pixel
